oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tennessee State Historical Marker 3A 20, The James Gang, Nashville, Tennessee, n.d.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A Tennessee Historical Commission marker commemorating The James Gang presence in the Nashville, Tennessee area, stating “In this building, then a combination saloon and grocery, W.L. Earthman, magistrate and ex-constable of Davidson County, on March 25, 1881, arrested Bill Ryan, alias Tom Hill, ruthless and indiscreet member of the James gang, members of which were living in the Edgefield neighborhood. Frank and Jesse James and their families left the Nashville area the next day.” The location of the marker is on Whites Creek Pike (U.S. 431) south of Old Hickory Blvd, Whites Creek TN. Forms part of the Bill Goodman Photographic Slides Collection. 1 35 mm negative.
